humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions from " sweeping " to " free " province, " won " is like holding a whip, and the upper part is the " free " province shape, as the sound symbol. Or add from " people ", like holding a whip and whipping people. The original meaning is whip and whip.

Bronze inscriptions are the same as the ancient prose " 𠓠 " in " Shuowen ". Xiaozhuan adds " leather " to indicate the quality of the whip.

Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning of whip. He also said that whipping is a kind of punishment, scattered: "If you have a heart thief, you will be fined a thousand lashes and discarded."

"Said the text": "... Drive from leather 𠊳 also sound 𠓠, classical 𩌻" Duan reform " drive " to " assault ", says: "brawl, was also thump."
humanum_short_description_en: Jinwen means the shape of a person holding a whip and whipping. The original meaning is whip and whip.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「攴」從「免」省，「攴」象手持鞭子，上部是「免」的省形，作為聲符。或加從「人」，象手持鞭子鞭打人之形。本義是鞭子、鞭打。

　　金文與《說文》古文「𠓠」形同。小篆加從「革」以表示鞭子的質料。

　　金文用作本義，表示鞭子。又表示鞭打，是刑罰的一種，散盤：「余有散氏心賊，則鞭千罰千，傳棄之。」

　　《說文》：「驅也。从革𠊳聲。𠓠，古文𩌻。」段玉裁改「驅」為「毆」，云：「毆，捶擊物也。」
humanum_short_description: 金文表示手持鞭子鞭打人之形。本義是鞭子、鞭打。

鞭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［biān］
［《廣韻》卑連切，平仙，幫。］
亦作“鞕3”。
(1)打马。
(2)鞭打；敲打。
(3)引申指驱赶。
(4)马鞭。
(5)泛指鞭子。
(6)督促；勉励。

(11)古代茶具名。
(12)成串的小爆竹，也叫小鞭。
(13)量词。用于光线和景色。前面的数词限用“一”，表示狭长。
